titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William Swindells photographic collection on the paperboard industry
Swindells (William) photographic collection on the paperboard industry

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-01-16.

langusage.language: Finding aid is written in English.

profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard), 2nd Edition.

did.unittitle: William Swindells photographic collection on the paperboard industry
did.abstract: Small collection of black and white photographs documenting the production of paperboard in the Willamette Valley area, specifically at the plants of Western Corrugated, Inc. in Beaverton, Oregon, and Western Kraft Corp. in Albany, Oregon.

prefercite.p: William Swindells photographic collection on the paperboard Industry, Org. Lot 1191, Oregon Historical Society Research Library.

processinfo.p: The photographs in the collection were originally contained in two folios or albums, which were individually designated as Album 666 and Album 667 by the Oregon Historical Society Research Library. The photographs were placed in archival envelopes for preservation, and the album or folio covers were retained in the collection.

scopecontent.p: Collection consists of 37 black and white photographs, circa 1955-1956, documenting the production of paperboard in the Willamette Valley area, specifically at the plants of Western Corrugated, Inc. in Beaverton, Oregon, and Western Kraft Corp. in Albany, Oregon. Included are images of cardboard processing, cutting, and printing, as well as machinery and models of the plants.

userestrict.p: The Oregon Historical Society owns the materials in the Research Library and makes available reproductions for research, publication, and other uses. The Society does not necessarily hold copyright to all materials in the collections. In some cases, permission for use may require seeking additional authorization from copyright owners.
